title: BRAVE Day for Sophomores - November 14th
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content: BRAVE Day at Talawanda High School is our annual family building and diversity event for our Sophomore class. The focus of the day is on making students realize that they are not alone at Talawanda, and they have many other peers and adults that care about and support them. Our students are a large part of our community, and by sharing stories, participating in activities, and most importantly - listening - they realize the important role they play with their classmates. Since 2009, BRAVE Day has been an influential part of our Anti-bullying, personal empowerment program at THS and our students come out of this experience better people for it.The event will take place…FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 14TH The effort that our students put into the day is an amazing thing to witness. Not only do students participate, they also encourage each other throughout the day on a level that is not normally seen in a typical High School. As a School District we appreciate their willingness to let go of their normal day and try to become a better person. Talawanda is thankful for them, and realizes that we have some of the most caring students around.If you feel your student would not benefit from the day, or would be negatively affected by the activities provided, they are not required to attend. We will not force students to participate, but rather want to provide the opportunity for them to improve as Talawanda students during BRAVE Day. They should stay in class during the event if they do not want to attend.

summary: **BRAVE Day** is Talawanda High School's annual family building, diversity, and anti-bullying event for **sophomores only**, taking place **Friday, November 14th**. The day focuses on helping students realize they're not alone and building community through sharing stories, activities, and listening. Students participate voluntarily and are encouraged to attend, but those who feel they would not benefit may stay in their regular classes instead.

title: FCCLA Hosts Annual Veterans Day Breakfast
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content: FCCLA is honored and excited to once again host the Veteran’s Day breakfast and assembly. If you are a Veteran, please RSVP at this link and join us on November 11th!

summary: FCCLA is hosting the **Annual Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly** on **Tuesday, November 11, 2025** at Talawanda High School (5301 University Park Blvd. Oxford, Ohio 45056). Breakfast begins at **7:30 AM** followed by an assembly at **9:00 AM**. All veterans and one guest are invited to attend. RSVP approval is required - please scan the QR code or email **croucherk@talawanda.org** with the veteran's full name, branch of service, and total number attending.

title: PUSH Program Home Repair Grants Available
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
zoom_out_map
            
PUSH Program
PUSH provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. Call Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 for more information. Application is attached. Http://www.push-oxford.org/

summary: **PUSH Program** provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. For more information or to apply, contact Jeanne or Sabrina at **513-523-8100** or visit [http://www.push-oxford.org/](http://www.push-oxford.org/).

summary:
Talawanda School District provides access to several food assistance resources:
- **[Calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule](link provided)** - Shows when and where free community meals are available
- **[Complete list of Butler County food pantries](link provided)** - Directory of all local food pantries in the area
- **[SNAP (food assistance) information](link provided)** - Details about applying for government food assistance benefits

Additional resources include Little Free Pantries at all TSD buildings (restocked weekly), Backpack Program at elementary schools (food provided Thursdays/Fridays), and emergency food boxes available within 24 hours.

title: Winter EOC Testing Schedule and Information
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education
summary:
**Individual Testing (12/3-12/5):** For students needing to meet graduation requirements and first-time testers not taking that class at THS. Contact Mrs. Hess for make-up testing.

**Class Testing (12/16-12/19):** ONLY for students currently taking an Algebra C or Government class, administered during exam week. Make-up testing: 1/7-1/8.

Emails will be sent to students and primary parent/guardian before Thanksgiving Break with specific test details and schedule. Questions should be directed to Mrs. Hess at **hessb@talawanda.org**.

summary:
**Weekly club meetings scheduled November 3-7:**
- **Monday, Nov 3:** Diversity Club (room 400), Setting Stone (room 320), Tribune (room 315) - all at 2:30pm
- **Tuesday, Nov 4:** NO SCHOOL for students; Mock Trial 5:00pm-7:00pm (room 315)
- **Wednesday, Nov 5:** Robotics Club 2:30pm-4:00pm (room 412, all welcome)
- **Thursday, Nov 6:** Best Buddies Tutorial (Cafeteria), Chess Club (room 603), Key Club Tutorial (room 218), Mock Trial (room 315), Project Green (room 224), Robotics Club (room 412)
- **Friday, Nov 7:** Drama 2:30pm-5:30pm (PAC)

title: FCCLA Blood Drive - Save Lives
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education
summary: **FCCLA is hosting a blood drive on November 7, 2025** from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM at the Talawanda Intermediate Auxiliary Gym. The drive addresses the American blood shortage and helps those needing blood for illnesses, transplants, and other medical needs. Healthy individuals aged 16-65 can donate. Free snacks and 1 hour of rest provided. TSD approved for distribution. For more information: +513-273-3200 or CROUCHERK@TALAWANDA.ORG
